tool_calls.input_summary: {"title": "Unified skill-agent architecture with MCP orchestration", "body": "A new framework is emerging based on the tooling we have developed. This is almost exactly what we have now\u2014just upda...

input_full.title: Unified skill-agent architecture with MCP orchestration
input_full.body:
A new framework is emerging based on the tooling we have developed. This is almost exactly what we have now—just updating a few things and making the observation that we are essentially doing the same thing over and over again with slight variations. This suggests we should commonize and more deeply integrate the tooling. This follows the design philosophy we have been using the entire time.

## Proposed Architecture

### 1. Single General-Purpose Agent
There is a single `sbs-developer` agent, designed to be general purpose.

### 2. Skills Spawning Agent Instances
We have a small number of skills, each of which spawns an instance of that agent:
1. **Task** - General agentic task execution
2. **Oracle** - (requires changing from custom agent to skill)
3. **Update and archive** - Documentation refresh and porcelain state
4. **Improver agent** - (requires changing from custom agent to skill)
5. **Self improve** - Recursive self-improvement through archive analysis

### 3. MCP Tools in 1-1 Correspondence
We have a custom MCP with tools in 1-1 correspondence with those skills, each of which orchestrates a general purpose agent whose objective is to complete the assigned skill. The orchestration uses our custom state tracking system to give the newly spawned agent highly efficient situational awareness, and helps couple it to our archival system.

### 4. Gated Workflows
The MCP tool call/skill follow a well-prescribed workflow with gates. Every gate must use our custom testing infrastructure to determine if things can proceed or not. The gating process is deeply coupled to the archival system, as well as the state tracking/context engineering for agent deployment.

## Updates Needed to Enable

- `/Users/eric/GitHub/Side-By-Side-Blueprint/dev/markdowns/permanent/Archive_Orchestration_and_Agent_Harmony.md` should be updated accordingly and will likely become a more cohesive document describing the unified architecture.

---
🤖 Created with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
